text.headline: Brambles - A New Golf Course in California
text.text:
In California's wine country off Highway 29 in Middletown lies Brambles, designed by Bill Coore and Ben Crenshaw. James Duncan was the onsite design lead. Coore Crenshaw are renowned for his minimalist designs highlighting the natural landscape.

The 495+ acre property features a narrow waterway similar to the Swilcan Burn. There is an airport runway onsite. California Environmental Quality Act filed with Lake County enumerates water usage with two wells onsite, annual precipitation estimates, and irrigation requirements. The report estimated the cut-to-fill requirement at 46,500 cubic yards.
